Installation¶

Get this repository to your hard drive using

git clone https://github.com/mdw771/adorym

and then use PIP to build and install:

pip install ./adorym
If you will modify internal functions of Adorym, e.g., add new

forward | models or refinable parameters, it is suggested to use the -e flag to | enable editable mode so that you don’t need to rebuild Adorym each time | you make changes to the source code:

pip install -e ./adorym
After installation, type python to open a Python console, and

check | the installation status using import adorym. If an ImportError occurs, | you may need to manually install the missing dependencies. Most | dependencies are available on PIP and can be acquired with

pip install <package_name>

or through Conda if you use the Anaconda or Miniconda distribution of Python:

conda install <package_name>
In order to run Adorym using PyTorch backend with GPU support, please
make sure the right version of PyTorch that matches your CUDA version
is installed. The latter can be checked through nvidia-smi.
